required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ET-02 in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory B-cell Malignancy(NHL/ALL)
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory,Open-label,and Single Center Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of ET-02 in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory B-cell Malignancies(NHL/ALL).

collaborator.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Henan University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of CD19-UCART in patients with r/r B-cell hematological malignancies.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 2 years after lymphodepleting chemotherapy
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events assessed according to NCI-CTCAE v5.0 criteria

arm_group.arm_group_label: Four escalating dose-levels of ET-02 will be evaluated using a "3+3" design.

intervention.description: A conditioning therapy with cyclophosphamide and fludarabine will be conducted before ET-02 injection.
intervention.arm_group_label: Four escalating dose-levels of ET-02 will be evaluated using a "3+3" design.

facility.name: •The First Affiliated Hospital of Henan University of Science and Technology
